alert.note: Alert for Bryce Canyon Country; Upper Sevier River Valleys (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 2:24PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Garfield County through 300 PM MDT... At 224 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Panguitch, or 26 miles south of Junction, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Garfield County. This includes US Route 89 between mile markers 136 and 138. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bryce Canyon Country; Upper Sevier River Valleys
